topics.learning_outcomes: Use appropriate language to talk about an extended family. Use appropriate language to describe seasons of the year. Use appropriate language to name different places in the community. Use appropriate language to talk about good practices in the community. Give and follow a series of instructions. Use appropriate language to discuss different occupations in the community. Use appropriate language to express feelings. Use appropriate language to express personal opinions. Use appropriate language to describe wild animals.
Use appropriate language to demonstrate manners and good behaviour.
Use language to engage in simple plays.
Use appropriate language in singing songs.
Use appropriate language to describe people.
Use appropriate language in playing games.

subtopics: Blend and read words with alternative spelling choices of consonants
Blend and read words with alternative spelling choices of vowels
Use alternative spelling choices of digraphs to blend and read words
Blend and read words using trigraphs
topics.learning_outcomes: Sound alternative spelling choices of consonants. Blend and read words using alternative spelling choices of consonants. Sound alternative spelling choices of vowels. Blend and read words with alternative spelling choices of vowels. Identify alternative spelling choices of digraphs. Use alternative spelling choices of digraphs to blend and read words. Sound out trigraphs in words. Blend and read words using trigraphs. Sound initial and final consonant blends.
Read texts with understanding. Read a variety of texts for pleasure.
Write lower and upper case letters using tailed handwriting. Write decodable and sight words. Write phrases. Write sentences. Write paragraphs.
Write words, phrases and simple sentences independently.
Sequence words according to alphabetical order. Sequence words and sentences logically.
Spell words correctly. Write dictated words, phrases and sentences.
Demonstrate knowledge of synonyms. Demonstrate knowledge of antonyms.
Demonstrate knowledge of nouns. Demonstrate knowledge of verbs. Demonstrate knowledge of prepositions. Demonstrate knowledge of conjunctions. Demonstrate knowledge of possessive words.
Use commas and question marks in sentences.
